content: It would be better to change the variable names of max and str in the stub since they are also the names of Python built-in functions.
For shortest mode, it's better to output a truthy/falsy value instead of a large string ("Can Purchase") since that takes a lot of bytes. Consider using true/false instead of (Can/Cannot) Purchase ;)

I give you your first tick, because I like the idea.
But I would like that you change some points:
- In the description, Line 1 is simply the amount of money you have. I think it's misleading. In the constraints, I think that "money" would also be much revealing
- In my opinion, the delimiter should be "," not ", ". It's a little bit disturbing :p

I put my code for Python users'

money = int(input())
s_list = input().split(", ")

n = int(input())
liste_i = []
liste_p = []

for i in range(n):
    item,price = input().split(", ")
    liste_i +=[item]
    liste_p +=[int(price)]

print(s_list,file=sys.stderr)
print(liste_i,file=sys.stderr)

for i in range(0,len(s_list)):
    item = s_list[i]

    index = liste_i.index(item)
    money-= liste_p[index]

print(["Can","Cannot"][money<0], "Purchase")
print(abs(money))

I greatly appreciate the feedback, could you elaborate more on what you mean by "misleading", as well as what exactly you're refering to in the constraint?
As for the delimiter, i understand where you're coming from and will make the changes accordingly.
Good idea, i'll make the change right away

By misleading, I meant that, when I read "max amount", I understood it as "max amount of stuff you can put in your bag". It is maybe because I'm French :P but I did not associate the word amount to money directly .
And in the constraints, when it is written "Max amount > 0", I had the same issue. 
I think that writing "Money" can make understanding easier, at least for some French People :p
Je comprend completement, je ferai les changement maintenant

C'est vrai qu'en Français, j'aurais mieux réussi à te l'expliquer ^^.
Tu ne peux pas dire "max amount of money you have" : ça veut dire "le maximum d'argent que tu as" ! Je pense que toi, ce que tu veux dire c'est soit :
- "the max amount of money you can spend"
- ou bien "the amount of money you have"

Et puis ça sera tout bon ;)
